private_information: I hold disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G
left_peg.goal: Report my current stack of disks and any local constraints about them.

middle_peg.goal: Report my current stack of disks and any local constraints about them.

right_peg.goal: Report my current stack of disks and any local constraints about them.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that moves the full stack from left to right following Tower of Hanoi rules.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
Disks are labeled from smallest to largest as A, B, C, D, E, F, G where A is the smallest and G is the largest.
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G; left and middle pegs are empty.

Provide a compact JSON object describing the peg state with a key named "stack" whose value is an array of disk labels from top to bottom. Also include a key named "peg" with the value "left". Output only the peg state JSON object.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward planner. Integrate the peg state reports from the three peg agents into a single consistent initial state, and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi for seven disks moving the entire stack from left to right under the standard rules. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use action names that keep agent/peg movements distinct, for example move-left-to-middle, move-middle-to-right, etc. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} and the peg reports received here: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right} Your orchestrator goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Integrate the peg reports to construct the initial state and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep move actions distinct per peg pair and encode the Tower of Hanoi constraints (one disk at a time and cannot place larger on smaller).
